quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Phrase and Percentage
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, inauguration, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Normal saline solution contains this percentage of salt (NaCl)?
8 is the square root of 64.
What is the name of the first full length movie to use color?

options.text: The World, the Flesh And the Devil

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The World, the Flesh And the Devil

questions.question: It is generally accepted that this was the first novel whose manuscript was typed on a typewriter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer

questions.question: What is Americas first continuously-published newspaper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston News-Letter

questions.question: Which Amendment  to the US Constitution guarantees the right to privacy?

options.text: It is not guaranteed in the Constitution

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is not guaranteed in the Constitution

questions.question: The First Inauguration of a US President included saying the phrase, So help me God, and kissing the Bible after taking the oath. Who was the President that set the precedent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: Conakry is the capital of Turkey.
Who was the first guest star to step off the plane on Fantasy Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Bixby

questions.question: When US President James Garfield was assassinated, this famous inventor tried to use his new metal detector to help the surgeons find the bullet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander G. Bell

questions.question: When was the first Copper Penny created?
Naruto Uzumaki, the protagonist of the Naruto series, marries Sakura.
Who is the first State of the Union Address attributed to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: Who made the first chocolate bar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. S. Fry  Sons

questions.question: Panama is located in South America.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Definition and Year
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, triple. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The iPhone is the only 3G phone.
Is Saint Nicolas the patron saint of sailors and merchants in Eastern Orthodox countries?
Which definition is incorrect?

options.text: Halophile - one who has an affinity for direct light.
Petrophile - one who loves or has an affinity for rocks.
Ombrophile - an animal or plant that has an affinity for large amounts of rainfall.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Halophile - one who has an affinity for direct light.

questions.question: Which statement  about the phobias of these fictional characters is untrue?

options.text: Beatrix Kidd from Kill Bill had an unreasonable fear of being  buried alive.
Ron Weasley from the Harry Potter books had an unreasonable fear of spiders.
Fox Mulder from The X-Files had an unreasonable fear of  fire.
Winston Smith from the book 1984 had an unreasonable fear of birds.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Smith from the book 1984 had an unreasonable fear of birds.

questions.question: Barack Obama is a righty.
Who does not belong to this list of high school dropouts: Julie Andrews, Marlon Brando, Johnny Depp, Demi Moore, Avril Lavigne, Christina Applegate, Jude Law, Leah Remini, John Travolta, Ed Norton.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Norton

questions.question: Who was on the cover of the first issue of  People magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mia Farrow

questions.question: More than 5 million Jews were killed during the Holocaust.
In Greek mythology, Atlas was an Olympian god.
Was the year 1912 a leap year?
What is the fastest bird of prey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peregrine Falcon

questions.question: How many bones does the human spine have?
Was professional wrestler Triple H born in Massachusetts?
Nonmember Runescape players can go to Taverly and kill a couple of druids. Then they can go to Camelot bank and take out 1,000 gold pennies.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester United

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Fear and Phobia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Stark

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Sheppard

questions.question: Which statement about the name Florence Nightingale Graham is true?

options.text: It is the real name of  Billie Holliday.
It is the married name of the famous nurse, Florence Nightingale
It is a pseudonym for the author Agatha Christie.
It is the real name of the famous beauty expert and business woman Elizabeth Arden.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the real name of the famous beauty expert and business woman Elizabeth Arden.

questions.question: Fictional character Barbara Morse graduated from the Georgia Institute of Technology with a Ph.D. in biology and helped rediscover the Super-Soldier formula that created Captain America. She eventually became this super heroine.
What did French engineer Louis Reard invent in 1946 ?

options.text: the first complete fossil of a triceratops
the chemical test for prostate cancer (The PSA test)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Bikini

questions.question: Which of Jim Hensons Muppets was the first one to be a regular on The Jimmy Dean Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rowlf  the Dog

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fear and Ink
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, diseases, nyctophobia. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was the first fountain pen invented?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Printing and Writing

questions.question: Nyctophobia means fear of darkness.
Where does the oldest known ink come from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China and India

questions.question: If swallowed, ink is harmless.
Ochlophobia is the fear of being shut in.
Claustrophobia means fear of cellars.
You are doing a handwriting analysis test. You choose green ink. What does this say about you?

options.text: You are very friendly and spiritual.
You have a desire to stand out from the crowd.
You are adaptable and desire harmony.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You are adaptable and desire harmony.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ink reservoir

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Year and Earth
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, zeppelin, rhode. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In this year, Led  Zeppelin  released Stairway to Heaven and  Andrew Lloyd Webbers Jesus Christ Superstar opened.
Find the correct statement about the monsoons.

options.text: They blow East from the Arabian Peninsula in  February and West from the South China Sea in August.
They blow West from Pakistan in February and East  from the Pacific in September.
They blow North from Australia in July and South from Asia in January.
They blow North from The Indian Ocean in January and South from Asia in  August.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They blow North from Australia in July and South from Asia in January.
